intro: Poitea gracilis, commonly known as the slender poitea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, palmate leaves. It produces yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, which attract various pollinators. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
